page.title: 01BODIAM AND EWHURST
page.content: In this area, which mainly consists of{woodland}and{grassland},there are two small areas of habitation - the {villages}of Bodiam and Ewhurst. Bodiam, once well known to Londoners for its{hop-picking}season, now relies upon the ancient{castle}to attract seasonal visitors. Ewhurst, voted "Best kept village in Sussex" in 1981, is a rather more isolated community of residents. Other prominent features in the area include the{river}Rother , which eventually flows into the English Channel at Rye, and the main A229{road}, along which people travel between Hawkhurst and the A21 from London to Hastings. In essence this is an area of quiet countryside utilized mainly by a number of{farms}and two small communities of people.
